title: Price hike for inelastic tickets increases TR

content.question: A city transit authority increases the price of sub- way and bus tickets from $1.25 to $1.50. If the demand for these tickets is price inelastic, the number of people riding buses and subways and the cityâ€™s revenues will most likely change in which of the following ways?

choices.label:
Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Increase
 Increase

Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Decrease
 Increase

Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Decrease
 Decrease

Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Decrease
 Remain constant

Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Remain constant
 Increase

content.answer:
Number of People Riding
 City's Revenues

Decrease
 Increase

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
